p.s: Enclosed is the proposed business plan for the e-commerce company providing energy-efficient light bulbs, "Enlighten".
Climate change is of the utmost importance in today's market place, providing an ideal opportunity for any company offering energy-efficient solutions.
Government legislation may soon see all wasteful incandescent lighting banned for general lighting purposes showing long term advantages and security for the company.

Enlighten will offer a high level of service to customers including rapid email response and telephone advice & assistance to build a customer base, differentiating itself from its competitors in the e-commerce market.
Employee relationships with research teams developing the latest technologies in the lighting sector will offer exclusive products.
The managing director of the firm has had previous experience starting a profitable online business providing similar products.
To start up this business we require a Flexible Business Loan up to the value of £70,000 for initial funding.
Alongside this we have £20,000 collected of personal finance to invest in this company.
We have qualified for a Small Firms Loan Guarantee with the DTI to make this funding possible.
To reduce start-up costs the firm shall locate in a home office in Royal Leamington Spa (200sq feet).
Enlighten will be a limited liability company, privately owned by and .
To provide a quality service, building a customer base of 3,000 customers at the end of the first year.
Achieve a turnover of £150,000 in the first year, £220,000 in the second year and £300,000 in the third year with profits of £30,000, £44,000 and £60,000 respectively.
Sell 0.7% of all CFL's sold in the UK by the end of the third year, providing the turnover shown.

p.s: We aim to sell a wide range of energy saving and CFL (Compact Fluorescent Lamp) bulbs.
Within the next few years, legislation will come in which may force businesses to use such bulbs, so we intend to establish ourselves now as leaders in this market.
We shall supply low price bulbs of a range of qualities, as positioned in the map above.
For a successful marketing campaign, we must look at the "Four P's".
These are Product, Promotion, Price and Place.
I will now investigate how these different sections can further our business.

p.s: The energy-saving light bulb segment is fast growing, and there is a rapidly growing demand for these products by consumers.

As referenced in the introductory letter, there is an opportunity to take advantage of possible future legislation changes in the type of light bulbs that will be available, energy-savers being the focus.
As seen by the table on the following page, CFL (Compact Fluorescent Lamp) sales increased by 110% over the 4-year period, indicating a clear direction for the market as a whole.
Enlighten will concentrate on maximising their sales by focusing on selling CFLs.

head.hi: UK retail sales of lamps (bulbs/tubes), by type, 2001-05

p.s: From figure 1 we can see that the size in terms of total units sold does not change significantly over the four year period.
However if we look at the market size in terms of retail sales, we can see an overall upward trend in the amount of money in this market.
Figure 2 shows a clear increase in market value, despite no rise in units sold.
According to Mintel, however this is due to rising sales of specialist lighting, but this is linked directly to trends in luminaries/fittings sales.
For CFLs, retail prices are falling, and therefore Enlighten must concentrate on sourcing cheap manufacturers in order to secure a decent profit margin.
